description:
This is an attempt to make the field list docs more readable:

http://yt-project.org/docs/dev/reference/field_list.html#field-list

my sphinx is not all that great, and other than looking over the output of the revised script to see if it parses by eye, I am not able to see the final HTML output of this.
title: first pass at making the field list a nice table

pullrequest.title: first pass at making the field list a nice table

content.raw: my script should have only touched the frontend specific stuff, not the Universal fields, but this diff seems to show a lot was out of date there.
content.html: my script should have only touched the frontend specific stuff, not the Universal fields, but this diff seems to show a lot was out of date there.

content.raw:
There are instructions on building the docs here: http://yt-project.org/doc/developing/building_the_docs.html#building-the-documentation

You should only need to do a quick build to be able to see the updated field list.
content.html:

pullrequest.title: first pass at making the field list a nice table

content.raw: If things have escape codes in the display names that are not put in r"", then we mess stuff up in making the table.  This is mostly because I added the display name to the field information that this shows.  But it also catches a lot of bugs in frontends that have previously gone unnoticed.
content.html: If things have escape codes in the display names that are not put in r"", then we mess stuff up in making the table. This is mostly because I added the display name to the field information that this shows. But it also catches a lot of bugs in frontends that have previously gone unnoticed.

content.raw: ok, as best as I can tell, this is because gadget doesn't define a FieldInfo.  This is not something I touched with the reformatting of the output, so I don't think fixing it should be part of this PR.  I don't see any gadget-specific fields defined in the frontend anyway.
content.html: ok, as best as I can tell, this is because gadget doesn't define a FieldInfo. This is not something I touched with the reformatting of the output, so I don't think fixing it should be part of this PR. I don't see any gadget-specific fields defined in the frontend anyway.

content.raw: The gadget frontend uses the generic `SPHFieldInfo`.  Do you think you could special-case that?
content.html: The gadget frontend uses the generic SPHFieldInfo. Do you think you could special-case that?

content.raw:
After getting sick of staring at my research statement, I went ahead and fixed the script so Gadget will show up. If you pull [28227b001654](https://bitbucket.org/ngoldbaum/yt/commits/28227b0016541a7ecae197a488bae705c957f825) from my repository and push that change to your repo, this PR should auto-update. No need to merge, my change is a descendant of the tip of this PR.

Thanks again for looking at this!
content.html:
After getting sick of staring at my research statement, I went ahead and fixed the script so Gadget will show up. If you pull 28227b001654 from my repository and push that change to your repo, this PR should auto-update. No need to merge, my change is a descendant of the tip of this PR.

Thanks again for looking at this!

pullrequest.title: first pass at making the field list a nice table

content.raw:
In general, I think this looks good, but I'm wondering what happened to the ('io', X), ('all', X), and ('deposit', X) fields in the Universal List in the current version of the field list?

http://yt-project.org/docs/dev/reference/field_list.html#index-of-fields
content.html:
In general, I think this looks good, but I'm wondering what happened to the ('io', X), ('all', X), and ('deposit', X) fields in the Universal List in the current version of the field list?

http://yt-project.org/docs/dev/reference/field_list.html#index-of-fields

pullrequest.title: first pass at making the field list a nice table

content.raw: I didn't touch that part of the script, but it seems that what happens is that a fake ds is created and then we do `ds.index` and then look at `ds.field_info` when printing out the universal fields.  If I look at ds.field_info for a simple dataset outside of this script, I don't see the `('io', X)`, `('all', X)`, or `('deposit', X)` fields there either.  So maybe something changes in how `yt` loads these fields?
content.html: I didn't touch that part of the script, but it seems that what happens is that a fake ds is created and then we do ds.index and then look at ds.field_info when printing out the universal fields. If I look at ds.field_info for a simple dataset outside of this script, I don't see the ('io', X), ('all', X), or ('deposit', X) fields there either. So maybe something changes in how yt loads these fields?

pullrequest.title: first pass at making the field list a nice table

content.raw:
The particle fields need to be explicitly passed to the `fields` list.  You can get a list of all of the particle field names that yt knows about from `StreamFieldInfo.known_particle_fields`.  They'll need to be added to the `fields` list as tuples like `('io', particle_field_name)`.

FWIW, it looks like the particle fields never would have shown up the way the `show_fields.py` script is currently written.
content.html:
The particle fields need to be explicitly passed to the fields list. You can get a list of all of the particle field names that yt knows about from StreamFieldInfo.known_particle_fields. They'll need to be added to the fields list as tuples like ('io', particle_field_name).

FWIW, it looks like the particle fields never would have shown up the way the show_fields.py script is currently written.

content.raw: @jzuhone or @MatthewTurk do you know what is going on, since you guys were involved with previous versions of this script?  My contributions to this script didn't involve the particle fields, but perhaps something got tweaked in the meantime?
content.html: John ZuHone or Matthew Turk do you know what is going on, since you guys were involved with previous versions of this script? My contributions to this script didn't involve the particle fields, but perhaps something got tweaked in the meantime?

pullrequest.title: first pass at making the field list a nice table

content.raw:
It's not perfect (I don't think `fake_random_ds` is passing all possible on-disk particle fields), but the following is a pretty good solution:

```
diff -r 28227b001654 doc/helper_scripts/show_fields.py
--- a/doc/helper_scripts/show_fields.py Tue Nov 25 16:59:28 2014 -0800
+++ b/doc/helper_scripts/show_fields.py Thu Nov 27 12:34:59 2014 -0800
@@ -38,7 +38,7 @@
 np.random.seed(int(0x4d3d3d3))
 units = [base_ds._get_field_info(*f).units for f in fields]
 fields = [_strip_ftype(f) for f in fields]
-ds = fake_random_ds(16, fields = fields, units = units)
+ds = fake_random_ds(16, fields=fields, units=units, particles=True)
 ds.parameters["HydroMethod"] = "streaming"
 ds.parameters["EOSType"] = 1.0
 ds.parameters["EOSSoundSpeed"] = 1.0
```

I tried doing what I suggested before using `known_particle_fields`, but that ended up not working due to weirdness in how the stream frontend sets up particle fields.
content.html:
It's not perfect (I don't think fake_random_ds is passing all possible on-disk particle fields), but the following is a pretty good solution:

diff -r 28227b001654 doc/helper_scripts/show_fields.py
--- a/doc/helper_scripts/show_fields.py Tue Nov 25 16:59:28 2014 -0800
+++ b/doc/helper_scripts/show_fields.py Thu Nov 27 12:34:59 2014 -0800
@@ -38,7 +38,7 @@
 np.random.seed(int(0x4d3d3d3))
 units = [base_ds._get_field_info(*f).units for f in fields]
 fields = [_strip_ftype(f) for f in fields]
-ds = fake_random_ds(16, fields = fields, units = units)
+ds = fake_random_ds(16, fields=fields, units=units, particles=True)
 ds.parameters["HydroMethod"] = "streaming"
 ds.parameters["EOSType"] = 1.0
 ds.parameters["EOSSoundSpeed"] = 1.0

I tried doing what I suggested before using known_particle_fields, but that ended up not working due to weirdness in how the stream frontend sets up particle fields.
